ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course effectively taught me the fundamentals of the Italian language. I learned how to talk in the present, past, present, and past imperfect in Italian, in addition to nouns, verbs, and grammatical standards. I am incredibly efficient in reading, writing, and speaking in Italian at the L1 level due to this course.
I learned how to speak, write, read, and comprehend Italian at a basic level. We studied grammar and vocabulary, as well as learning about the culture of the Italian people.
I obtained a knowledge base of fundamental Italian vocabulary and grammar (tenses included present, past, and imperfect).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class size is small and intimate. You learn well with your peers and the teacher like a family. The course has an appropriate pace, and the information is delivered well. No major weaknesses of the course come to mind.
This is a wonderful course! It is very interactive and the professor is engaging.

Strengths: logical following of the daily lessons, mix of both individual and partner work, close-knit environment allowed for increased student engagement and enriching discussions of Italian culture.
Weaknesses: The fast-paced nature of the course made it difficult to really hone in and practice certain grammar lessons that were more difficult to catch onto than others.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I recommend that students study a language that they can fall in love with. I love Italian because I am Italian and am fascinated by studying the language of my ancestors. I do think that this course is engaging, and I would absolutely recommend it to a student considering it, but I think it is better for students to pursue the language that they want to study.
Yes! It was educational and enjoyable!

Absolutely! The workload was certainly manageable and very fun as well. This is one of my favorite classes I have taken at Yale. I always looked forward to studying the language every night and was even more excited to attend class every day. I recommend this course to any student considering it.
